label: 東大寺献物帳
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 52nd  . Nara National Museum . 2000
見出し読み: とうだいじけんもつちょう
説明文: Dedicatory Records of Tōdai-ji. A compilation of five records of the offerings made to Tōdai-ji by Empress Kōmyō between 756-758. The records are: Kokka chimpō chō (Record of the Nation's Rare Treasures) , dated 21 June 756 Shuju yaku chō (Record of Various Medicines) , dated 21 June 756 Byōbu kasen tō chō (Record of Folding Screens, Patterned Rugs, Etc.) ,dated 26 July 756 Daishō-ō shinseki chō (Record of Calligraphic Writings of Wang Xizhi and his son Wang Xianzhi) , dated 1 June 758 Fujiwara-kō shinseki byōbu chō (Record of Folding Screens with Lord Fujiwara no Fuhito's Calligraphic Writings) , dated 1 October 758 Extant Shōsō-in treasures listed in these records are especially valuable on account of their clear historical origins. Of the seven-hundred objects listed in the Tōdai-ji kemmotsu chō, over one hundred are thought to be extant in the Shōsō-in today.　[光明、国家珍宝帳、種々薬帳、屏風花氈等帳、大小王真跡帳、藤原公真跡屏風帳、正倉院]
